subject: Leadership
title: Ethical Frameworks Overview
description: A micro-lesson that makes Ethical Frameworks Overview usable.

hook.text: Philosophers have debated right and wrong for millennia. Leaders need a toolkit, not a philosophy degree.

buildup.text: Three dominant frameworks: consequentialism judges outcomes, deontology judges duties, virtue ethics judges character.

discovery.text: No single framework is complete. Consequentialism can justify harm to minorities. Duty ethics can be rigid in crises.

twist.text: The best ethical leaders are pluralists. They draw from multiple frameworks depending on the situation.

climax.text: Learn all three. When they agree, act confidently. When they conflict, you've found the real ethical dilemma.

punchline.text: Ethics isn't having the right answer. It's asking the right questions.

quiz.question: Why should leaders use multiple ethical frameworks?
options: One framework always gives the right answer
No single framework is complete; combining them reveals true dilemmas
